briefdescription.para: It recovers a set of ckpt. files using RS decoding.

detaileddescription.para:
FTI_Conf
Configuration metadata.
FTI_Exec
Execution metadata.
FTI_Topo
Topology metadata.
FTI_Ckpt
Checkpoint metadata.
erased
The array of erasures.
integer FTI_SCES if successful.
This function tries to recover the L3 ckpt. files missing using the RS decoding.

briefdescription.para: It checks that all L1 ckpt. files are present.

detaileddescription.para:
FTI_Conf
Configuration metadata.
FTI_Exec
Execution metadata.
FTI_Topo
Topology metadata.
FTI_Ckpt
Checkpoint metadata.
integer FTI_SCES if successful.
This function detects all the erasures for L1. If there is at least one, L1 is not considered as recoverable.

memberdef.argsstring: (FTIT_configuration *FTI_Conf, FTIT_execution *FTI_Exec, FTIT_checkpoint *FTI_Ckpt, int destination, int ptner)
memberdef.name: FTI_SendCkptFileL2

detaileddescription.para:
FTI_Conf
Configuration metadata.
FTI_Exec
Execution metadata.
FTI_Ckpt
Checkpoint metadata.
destination
destination group rank.
ptner
0 if sending Ckpt, 1 if PtnerCkpt.
integer FTI_SCES if successful.
This function sends Ckpt or PtnerCkpt file from partner proccess.

memberdef.argsstring: (FTIT_configuration *FTI_Conf, FTIT_execution *FTI_Exec, FTIT_checkpoint *FTI_Ckpt, int source, int ptner)
memberdef.name: FTI_RecvCkptFileL2

detaileddescription.para:
FTI_Conf
Configuration metadata.
FTI_Exec
Execution metadata.
FTI_Ckpt
Checkpoint metadata.
source
Source group rank.
ptner
0 if receiving Ckpt, 1 if PtnerCkpt.
integer FTI_SCES if successful.
This function receives Ckpt or PtnerCkpt file from partner proccess.

briefdescription.para: It recovers L2 ckpt. files using the partner copy.

detaileddescription.para:
FTI_Conf
Configuration metadata.
FTI_Exec
Execution metadata.
FTI_Topo
Topology metadata.
FTI_Ckpt
Checkpoint metadata.
integer FTI_SCES if successful.
This function tries to recover the L2 ckpt. files missing using the partner copy. If a ckpt. file and its copy are both missing, then we consider this checkpoint unavailable.

briefdescription.para: It recovers L3 ckpt. files ordering the RS decoding algorithm.

detaileddescription.para:
FTI_Conf
Configuration metadata.
FTI_Exec
Execution metadata.
FTI_Topo
Topology metadata.
FTI_Ckpt
Checkpoint metadata.
integer FTI_SCES if successful.
This function tries to recover the L3 ckpt. files missing using the RS decoding. If to many files are missing in the group, then we consider this checkpoint unavailable.

briefdescription.para: It recovers L4 ckpt. files from the PFS.

detaileddescription.para:
FTI_Conf
Configuration metadata.
FTI_Exec
Execution metadata.
FTI_Topo
Topology metadata.
FTI_Ckpt
Checkpoint metadata.
integer FTI_SCES if successful.
This function tries to recover the ckpt. files using the L4 ckpt. files stored in the PFS. If at least one ckpt. file is missing in the PFS, we consider this checkpoint unavailable.

briefdescription.para: It recovers L4 ckpt. files from the PFS using POSIX.

FTI_Conf
Configuration metadata.
FTI_Exec
Execution metadata.
FTI_Topo
Topology metadata.
FTI_Ckpt
Checkpoint metadata.
integer FTI_SCES if successful.
This function tries to recover the ckpt. files using the L4 ckpt. files stored in the PFS. If at least one ckpt. file is missing in the PFS, we consider this checkpoint unavailable.

briefdescription.para: It recovers L4 ckpt. files from the PFS using MPI-I/O.

FTI_Conf
Configuration metadata.
FTI_Exec
Execution metadata.
FTI_Topo
Topology metadata.
FTI_Ckpt
Checkpoint metadata.
integer FTI_SCES if successful.
This function tries to recover the ckpt. files using the L4 ckpt. files stored in the PFS. If at least one ckpt. file is missing in the PFS, we consider this checkpoint unavailable.

briefdescription.para: It recovers L4 ckpt. files from the PFS using SIONlib.

detaileddescription.para:
FTI_Conf
Configuration metadata.
FTI_Exec

FTI_Topo

FTI_Ckpt
Checkpoint metadata.
integer FTI_SCES if successful.
This function tries to recover the ckpt. files using the L4 ckpt. files stored in the PFS. If at least one ckpt. file is missing in the PFS, we consider this checkpoint unavailable.
